moves.1. d4: A benoni, with white trying a pawn storm
moves.11. Bh4 O-O 12. Re1: White intends to push his e pawn
moves.13. Nd2: to make place for the LSB
moves.14. f4: weakening the white king but adding pressure on e5
moves.15. Bf3 Bb7: Joining the rooks and setting the bishop on the big diagonal
moves.16. Rc1: Rook in front of the black queen
moves.16... Nb6: to make place for the f knight
moves.17... Rac8: to replace the queen on the c file
moves.18... Nh7: The king side has to be reinforced
moves.19. Ne2 c4: Black has to take some initiative
moves.20. bxc4 bxc4 21. Nf1: probably planning a further Ng3 to increase the pressure on the king side
moves.22. Bg3: Bishop on the same diagonal the the black queen
moves.24. h3: white carries on with pawn storm
moves.24... Nfd7: To be able to counterattack if white plays f5
moves.25. Nb5: menacing the queen but it's a mistake
moves.25... Qc5+: obvious move, the b knight is doomed
moves.28... Rdc8 29. h4: increasing the pressure on the kingside
moves.30. Re3: enabling to double rooks but it's a mistake
moves.30... Nd3: to menace  the unprotecte f4 pawn
moves.32... cxd3: Black opts for the queen trade, having a material advantage
moves.33. Qxc8 Qxf2+: White submits here for after 34. Kxf2 Rxc8, black will have one rook advance (and a passed pawn)
